column4: Hello everyone.  Just wondering if their is a Bash command to switch to a different ubuntu "workspace".  Any help is appreciated.

i guess bash doesn't know much about your X session, definiately not the workspaces so .. i guess there's not without some minor coding, check the source of the workspace switcher applet maybe, no better idea.
switch to uid0 and emulate keypresses :D

maybe get a keylogger source code so you know how to interact with the keyboard .. but it's really messy to do. Rather write a "server" that runs on the graphical interface, and a client that connects to it so it should work, but no simple solution
